title: The evidence for the existence of Ptolemy IX’s two sons is fully discussed by Otto and Bengtson, 1938:117, n.1. They are not included by Sullivan, 1990 in his Ptolemaic stemma. If they did exist and were among the grandchildren of Cleopatra III sent to Cos for safekeeping in 103 BC and later captured by Mithradates VI in 88 BC, their presence as hostages at the Pontic court may explain Ptolemy IX’s refusal in 87/ 6 BC to provide Lucullus with a fleet against Mithradates
